part.name: enter_commons
part.narration: In the commons room sit Yuki's parents. Asami, curled on a wheeled chair, seats a-crescent, strumming. Jacques reads a newspaper. Enter Yuki.Yuki runs into the view of the camera again, and the player reassumes control.
Yuki takes a deep breath, looks her mother in the eyes, and speaks in second-tongue:
part.line: Good night!
part.narration: Asami looks out of the window and into the sun.
part.line: What a fine night this is.
part.narration: Yuki frowns.
part.line: Is my Japanese still that terrible? I'm never right.
part.narration: Asami pats Yuki.
part.line: Being right is only half the battle.
Remember that greatness knows not language nor country.
part.narration: Asami relaxes, spine concave. Her neck parallels the tile. Yuki folds her arms.
part.line: Mom, you're sitting funny again.
It's scary.
part.narration: Asami frowns. Fleeting violent twitch. Calm. Breathing practice. Asami relaxes further, placing her feet on the tall table. She laughs?
part.line: My condolences, little explorer. I need the moon to stay a fortnight.
part.narration: Yuki pivots to her father. Father glares at the technology section. The headline reads:
part.line: Ministry of Culture to Pass Software Identity Act
part.narration: Yuki frolics to Jacques.
part.line: Dad! Dad!
part.narration: Jacques peeks over his paper.
part.line: Yo.
part.narration: He looks back down at the newspaper. Asami glares at him. Yuki gushes.
part.line: Remember that old machine where the screen was acting funny?
Uh-huh.
I recompiled the graphics driver wrapper, and now double buffering works!
Cool.
part.narration: Yuki's excitement fades.
Jacques Jr, Yuki's brother, charges downstairs.
part.line: Mom! Mom!
part.narration: Asami looks up from her guitar.
part.line: Hi.
part.narration: She looks back down at her guitar.
part.line: I finally mastered the Freebird solo on ukelele!
That's nice.
part.narration: JJ's excitement fades—
part.line: My son!
part.narration: Jacques frolics to JJ and puts his hands on JJ's shoulders. JJ stands.
part.line: Hey.
part.narration: Jacques shakes JJ.
part.line: Okay, little man. Please tell me you found out why your for loops wouldn't count to ten.
Yeah! You're supposed to put a semicolon at the end of every line —
part.narration: Jacques nods, Jacques nods!
part.line: So I put one at the end of the for statement!
part.narration: Jacques face-palms.
part.line: Did you even read the book I gave you?
Well—
No matter. Intelligence lies in the realm of experience.
part.narration: JJ sighs.
part.line: Well, what if I—
part.narration: Jacques heaves up the picket-sign. Yuki picks up her picket-sign. JJ looks up at it. Oh no, are you going to do all of that yelling and screaming again? It's for a purpose. It's embarrassing. Good thing for you the walk to school is short. You'll both be late. Let's go. Jacques walks the children.Jacques and JJ are in Yuki's party. Yuki is the character controlled by the Player.Jacques pushes open the door. In the distance, all of that yelling and screaming. Again.
